name: SupportVanessaAndSyrene
_source: speak;Syrene;Vanessa!|How are you?|I was worried about you!
speak;Vanessa;I'm fine, ma'am.|Thank you for your concern.|Glad to see you doing well too.
speak;Syrene;Vanessa, you know you don't need to talk like that when we're alone.
speak;Syrene;Let me put it this way, then.|This is an order from your captain!|When we're alone, you are to speak to me as if we are at home.
speak;Syrene;Vanessa.|*Sigh*.|Did you listen to a word I said?
speak;Syrene;Ha ha ha!|Yes, that's it!|Oh, by the way, I have something for you.
speak;Syrene;Here you go.|Father wanted me to give it to you.
speak;Vanessa;But this is...|The war god Fale's amulet!

speak;Syrene;Yes, this is a battle amulet.|I received one before I left home, too.|You were summoned so suddenly that Father didn't get a chance to give it to you.|And Mother wanted to tell you, “Never be apart from this amulet.”
speak;Syrene;She also wanted you to relax and do your best.|And to get a good night's sleep always.

speak;Syrene;Maybe others don't notice, but I know you too well, Vanessa. I know you don't get enough rest when you feel overwhelmed with responsibility.|But, to be at your best, you need to take care of yourself, OK?
speak;Syrene;I'll be right by your side tonight, so just relax.|You need a good night's sleep.
speak;Vanessa;Thanks, Sis.|I sleep better when you're around.
speak;Syrene;You look better, Vanessa.|Did you sleep well?
speak;Vanessa;Yes.|First time in a long time.|Thank you, Sis.
speak;Syrene;I've been meaning to ask you...
speak;Syrene;You don't seem to have much appetite lately.
speak;Syrene;I told you, Vanessa, I know you too well.|So, who's the lucky guy?
speak;Vanessa;What?!|That's just crazy!|I don't know what you're talking about!

speak;Syrene;You know I can tell when you're lying.|Plus, you not eating is a dead giveaway.|I mean, when's the last time you said no to a cookie?|It's not a criticism.|One of your most charming qualities is how you can outeat anyone.|It's because of someone special, isn't it?
speak;Syrene;But, Vanessa, first and foremost, you have to take care of yourself.|I'll support you no matter what, but no one is worth losing your health over.

speak;Vanessa;Thank you, I guess.|I'll do my best...|Sometimes I think that if I were more like you-|you know, a great knight, an attractive woman, and just all-around perfect-|I'd have a better chance with him.
speak;Vanessa;Hmmm.|That didn't sound as pathetic in my head as it did out loud.
speak;Syrene;Don't be silly, Vanessa.|You may not know it, but I'm sure that person likes you for who you are.

speak;Vanessa;Do you really think so?|I've always wanted to be like you.|You've always been my role model.|But, I feel like whenever I finally catch up to you, you're already gone.|You've already moved on.|I'll never catch up with you, no matter how hard I try.
speak;Syrene;I'm very proud of you, Vanessa.|And as your older sister, I recognize your talent more than anyone else.|You should be more confident.
speak;Vanessa;I feel better after opening up to you.|It's hard not to compare myself with you, but I have to get past that.
speak;Syrene;That's the spirit.|And remember, you have to take care of yourself.
speak;Vanessa;Yes, I know.|As always, thanks, Syrene.
speak;Vanessa;Hi, Syrene.|Thanks for talking the other day.
speak;Vanessa;Well...|It's not that easy, but I quit comparing myself with you.
speak;Syrene;You might not know this, but there's something about you I've always envied.
speak;Syrene;You have an inner fortitude that I will never be able to match.

speak;Syrene;Do you remember when Father collapsed?|Mother and I were so panicked that we didn't know what to do.|You were the youngest of us all, but you gathered nuts in your small hands and went to the village to sell them.|Then you came home with medicine for him.
speak;Vanessa;Well, I don't know what to say.

speak;Syrene;When you face a difficult circumstance, your true self emerges.|You were very young, but had the presence of mind and ingenuity to help Father.|You comforted me and Mother, and you rescued Father.|I've always respected your strength, and wished for some of it myself.
speak;Vanessa;But...you were the one who joined the Knights at such an early age, and it was you who supported our family.

speak;Syrene;I emulated your strength.|I wanted to support my family like you did.|It's always been my goal.|And I respect you more than anyone else.|I wish you could be as confident in yourself as I am of you.|No matter what, you'll always be all right.
speak;Vanessa;All right, then.|I have to tell you!|The person I love is-

speak;Syrene;Wait, Vanessa!|Wait until the war is over to tell me.|When everything is over, bring him home.|I'll go home a little ahead of you, and wait for you two with Father and Mother.|We'll make your favorite meal... |Is that enough to convince you?
speak;Vanessa;Yes.|I'll do my best...|For this war and also for him.
speak;Syrene;That's my girl.|Don't worry.|You'll be alright.
